name: Legion of Super Heroes: Wildfire Quiz | Entertainment | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Drake Burroughs.

	Wildfire was first introduced in 'Superboy' (vol. 1) #195 in 1973.

questions.text: When auditioning for Legion membership, Wildfire originally used a different code name.  What was it?
questions.explanation:
Erg-1.

	Erg stood for "Energy Release Generator".

questions.text: When Wildfire originally auditioned for membership, he duplicated the powers of several existing members.  Which of the following was NOT one of those Legionnaires?
questions.explanation:
Cosmic Boy.

	He was originally rejected because he didn't reveal his one unique ability of energy blasting and manipulation.  Originally he did not think he had good enough control of this power.  It was this power however, that would eventually earn him full membership in the Legion.

Earth.

	Drake Burroughs, an Earthling, was an astroengineer before being caught in a blast of anti-matter energy and being turned into Wildfire.

questions.text: Like Ferro Lad before him, Wildfire wears a full helmet around his head.  Why is this?
questions.correct: He has no actual body, his costume contains his energy
options: The anti-matter blast that gave him his powers dramatically disfigured him
His helmet is simply a fashion choice
He is mistakenly wanted by the law, so the Legion allow him to hide his face
questions.explanation:
He has no actual body, his costume contains his energy.

	Wildfire's body was completely destroyed, and his consciousness now resides in pure anti-energy. That energy needs a containment suit to house it, and to allow Wildfire to "speak".

questions.text: Wildfire eventually developed feelings for a fellow Legion member.  Their relationship was very hot and cold, on and off, for many years.  Which member was it?
questions.explanation:
Dawnstar.

	Wildfire's lack of a physical body, along with his hotheadedness, hindered his infatuation with Dawnstar, though eventually she did express having feelings for him as well.

questions.text: For a brief time, Wildfire was able to function without his special suit.  Which fellow Legion member was responsible for this change?
questions.explanation:
Quislet.

	Quislet was a member of the Legion who was also comprised of energy.  He was able train Wildfire to maintain a physical body.  Wildfire was unable to maintain this ability after Quislet left the Legion.

questions.text: In the 5YL (Five Years Later) Legion continuity, Wildfire's energy is only able to be contained through the use of a host vessel.  It's revealed that Wildfire has been inhabiting a corpse in order to exist.  Who's corpse is it?
questions.explanation:
Sun Boy.

	Wildfire kept this information secret by continuing to use a containment suit even though he really no longer needed it because his energy was now "housed" inside of Sun Boy's dead body.

questions.text: In the Post Zero Hour/Reboot Legion continuity, Wildfire again becomes a Legionnaire.  In this continuity he is a being of pure energy, created from the combined energy of two fallen heroes.  Who were they?
questions.explanation:
Atom'X and Blast-Off.

	Atom'X was a member of the Amazers and Blast-Off was a member of Work Force.  Both were believed killed by Mordru, but somehow their minds were integrated into one consciousness comprised of pure energy.

questions.text: In "The Lightning Saga" crossover event that ushers the Legion's "Retroboot" continuity, Wildfire is found masquerading as a statue in Superman's Fortress of Solitude".  His being is contained inside which hero?
questions.explanation:
Red Tornado.

	Wildfire reveals that his containment suit is actually Red Tornado's android body.  Additionally, he shares some of Red Tornado's memories.
